Nerangs.ab: va aṣ̌əm va ahmāi raēšca tamām be-ḫᵛānad va barsom ke mi-činad bon va sar-e barsom mi-negarad va avval bon-e barsom bar bāyad čidan va az bālā-ye barsom meqdār-e yek dāne-ye ǧou bištar ne barad ke be-kār-i nayāyad va az bon-e barsom agar bištar ne bord šāyad va bāyad ke barsom ṭāq bāšad

"He recites one Aṣ̌əm Vohū and ahmāi raēšca until the end. When he cuts the barsom, he inspects the bottom and the top of the barsom. He must cut first the bottom of the barsom. He should not go further than the measure of a corn of barley that it cannot be employed for any task. It also allowed be it does not go further from the bottom of the barsom. The (twigs of the) barsom must be odd."
